quizzes.question: What does a markup language use to identify content?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Welcome to HTML! [/h1] HTML stands for [b]H[/b]yper[b]T[/b]ext[b] M[/b]arkup[b] L[/b]anguage. Unlike a scripting or programming language that uses scripts to perform functions, a markup language uses tags to identify content. Here is an example of an HTML tag:[code format="html" codeId="3"]

I'm a paragraph

[/code] [note]This course is a combination of interactive quizzes and exercises to facilitate speed and quality of learning. Tap the [b]Continue [/b]button to go to your first quiz![/note]

quizzes.question:
Rearrange the code to surround the text "I am learning HTML on SoloLearn!" with opening and closing

tags:
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]The Web Structure[/h1]

The ability to code using HTML is essential for any web professional. Acquiring this skill should be the starting point for anyone who is learning how to create content for the web.  

[b][h2]Modern Web Design[/h2][/b]
[b]HTML[/b]: Structure
[b]CSS[/b]: Presentation
[b]JavaScript[/b]: Behavior

[b]PHP or similar[/b]: Backend
[b]CMS[/b]: Content Management
[note]HTML is easy to learn. So don't wait! Dive right in![/note]
